intent.translation[0].definitions[0].def: giving careful attention to something so that you think about nothing else
intent.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Intent upon her work, she didnâ€™t notice the cold.
intent.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: She behaved foolishly but with good intent.
intent.translation[1].definitions[1].def: the intention to do something illegal
intent.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Jones was found guilty of wounding with intent.
He is charged with possession of a gun with intent to commit a robbery.
intent.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The two software companies have signed a letter of intent to merge.
intent.translation[2].definitions[1].def: the intention to do something illegal
intent.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: He pleaded guilty to charges of possessing unauthorized computer access codes with intent to defraud.
intent.translation[3].definitions[0].def: to be determined to do or achieve something
intent.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: The company is intent on expanding its oil and gas production business.
